summary: Ever wanted to be able to buy every property in the game and receive income from them? Ever wanted to become a landlord? Then this mod is for you.
descriptionHtml:
[center][url=http://www.skyrimgems.com][img]http://i.imgur.com/sSbds.png[/img][/url][/center]

[center][size=3]_______________________________________________________________________________________________________________[/size][/center]
[center][size=5]INTRODUCTION[/size][/center]
[size=3][center]This mod allows the Dovahkiin to become a landlord by purchasing and renting properties, like houses, shops, inns and more.
You can then use the income you receive from them to buy even more properties or you can just spend it as you want.

Are you still interested? Then keep on reading (or just go to the download section).[/center][/size]

[center][size=3]_______________________________________________________________________________________________________________[/size][/center]
[center][size=5]DESCRIPTION[/size][/center]
[size=3]This mod offers both simplicity, for casual gamers, and a high level of customisation, for pros. How is that done? Simple...
[list][*][size=3]Outside of most buildings, you'll find a [b][color=#00ffff]Property Sign[/color][/b]. Interact with it to buy, sell and rent properties, from which you'll earn income.[/size][/*]
[*][size=3]Use a [b][color=#00ffff]Master Ledger[/color][/b] to review your current status. You need also to keep it up to date, to do so you just need to select the "Ledger's quill" from your inventory.[/size][/*]
[*][size=3]Collect your income from [b][color=#00ffff]Safes[/color][/b] located in each jarl's palace. The safes are locked, so that no thieves will steal your rent. The key is automatically given to the player during the tutorial.[/size][/*]
[*][size=3]You can easily adjust *[i]any*[/i] setting using the MCM.[/size][/*]
[/list]

But owning a property is not only about earning money: you can also choose how much your tenants will have to pay you, and this will change the way they behave towards you:
[list][*][size=3]If you allow them to pay less than usual, they will offer you better prices (if they are merchants) and they'll be friendlier.[/size][/*]
[*][size=3]If you charge them too much, they'll offer higher prices and they'll dislike you, but you'll earn more money.[/size][/*]
[/list]

Different types of properties give you also different advantages:
[list][*][size=3]If you own a [color=#ffff00]Shop[/color], you will receive discounts on the wares sold.[/size][/*]
[*][size=3]If you own a [color=#ffff00]Mine[/color], you will receive ores extracted by your miners.[/size][/*]
[*][size=3]If you own a [color=#ffff00]Farm[/color], you can have delivered a part of the food produced by it.[/size][/*]
[/list][/size]


[center][size=3]________________________________________________________________________________________________________________[/size][/center]
[center][size=5]DIFFERENT TYPES OF PROPERTIES[/size][/center]
[size=3]Properties are divided into several categories, each with its own pros and cons:
[list][*][size=3][b][color=#ffff00]Houses[/color][/b]: cheapest but low income.[/size][/*]
[*][size=3][b][color=#ffff00]Shops[/color][/b]: expensive but high income.[/size][/*]
[*][size=3][b][color=#ffff00]Inns[/color][/b]: more expensive than shops but higher income.[/size][/*]
[*][size=3][b][color=#ffff00]Farms[/color][/b]: Increase income from inns or receive food.[/size][/*]
[*][size=3][b][color=#ffff00]Mines[/color][/b]: Provides you with ores, you can use them for smithing or you can sell them for coins.[/size][/*]
[*][size=3][b][color=#ffff00]Special Properties[/color][/b]: no income, but slightly raise overall income, and (in future versions) give you other advantages.[/size][/*]
[/list]

In order to buy a property you need also a perk (you can disable these requirements if you don't like them):
[list][*][size=3][i][color=#00ff00]Haggling[/color][/i] (the first level) for [color=#ffff00]Houses[/color];[/size][/*]
[*][size=3][i][color=#00ff00]Merchant[/color][/i] for [color=#ffff00]Shops[/color];[/size][/*]
[*][size=3][i][color=#00ff00]Investor[/color][/i] for [color=#ffff00]Inns[/color];[/size][/*]
[*][size=3][i][color=#00ff00]Master Trader[/color][/i] for [color=#ffff00]Special Properties[/color].[/size][/*]
[*][size=3]All the other properties don't need any perk to be bought.[/size][/*]
[/list][/size]


[center][size=3]________________________________________________________________________________________________________________[/size][/center]
[center][size=5]REQUIREMENTS[/size][/center]
[size=3]This mod requires both[i] [url=http://skse.silverlock.org/]SKSE[/url][/i] and [i][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/3863/]SkyUI[/url][/i] to work properly. If you don't have any of them, what are you waiting for? They are both amazing and really useful, so you don't really know what you're missing out![/size]


[center][size=3]________________________________________________________________________________________________________________[/size][/center]
[center][size=5]HOW TO INSTALL/UPDATE[/size][/center]
[size=3][color=red]How do I install the mod?[/color]
You may have noticed that starting from v3.0 there are two files instead of one. What do they do?
[list][*][size=3][color=orange]RE_RealEstate_Core[/color] stores your data, keeping track of which properties you own and of your settings;[/size][/*]
[*][size=3][color=orange]RE_RealEstate[/color] is basically everything else: it handles the MCM, signs, discounts, income, etc...[/size][/*]
[/list]
To install the mod simply download both files and put them in your Skyrim folder.

[color=red]How do I upgrade the mod?[/color]
[/size][list][size=3][/size][*][size=3][size=3]If you're updating from a version < 3.0 it's pretty tricky: v3.0 isn't compatible with previous versions, because of the way ownership is saved (items instead of local variables), so if you update the mod now, you will lose all your owned properties.[/size][/size][/*]
[list][*][size=3][size=3]If that isn't a problem remember to uninstall the previous version (go to [i]MCM > Real Estate > Uninstall[/i]): in this way you'll safely stop all the scripts running.[/size][/size][/*]
[*][size=3][size=3]If instead you don't want to lose them, just wait until I'll release a workaround for transferring ownership from versions < 3.0.[/size][/size][/*]
[/list][size=3][*][size=3]If, instead, you're updating from a version >= 3.0 you just need to replace the old files with the new ones.[/size][/*]
[/size][/list][size=3]

[color=red]How do clean saves work?[/color]
Simple: disable [color=orange]RE_RealEstate[/color], but NOT [color=orange]RE_RealEstate_Core[/color], load the game, save, exit, re-enable [color=orange]RE_RealEstate[/color] and continue playing! You made a clean save and you didn't lose your data![/size]


[center][size=3]________________________________________________________________________________________________________________[/size][/center]
[center][size=5]TRANSLATIONS[/size][/center]
[size=3]If you speak any of these languages, then you're in luck! My mod is available also in:
[/size][list][size=3][/size][*][size=3][size=3][url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/38352/]German[/url], thanks to [i]Dante2000[/i].[/size][/size][/*]
[*][size=3][size=3][url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/51974/]Polish[/url], thanks to [i]FeelThePoveR[/i].[/size][/size][/*]
[*][size=3][url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/53245/]Chinese[/url], thanks to [i]makiatskyrim[/i] and [i]eminem_luo[/i].[/size][/*]
[*][size=3][url=http://www.confrerie-des-traducteurs.fr/forum/viewtopic.php?f=195&t=18007&p=282909#p282909]French[/url], thanks to [i]Lysandus[/i].[/size][/*]
[*][size=3][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/57220/]Russian[/url] (available also [url=http://modgames.net/load/tes_v_skyrim/gejmplej/re_real_estate_nedvizhimost/247-1-0-18107]here[/url]), thanks to [i]coladragon13[/i].[/size][/*]
[/list][size=3]
If you're interested in translating my mod, please send me a PM.[/size]


[center][size=3]________________________________________________________________________________________________________________[/size][/center]
[center][size=5]F.A.Q.[/size][/center][size=3]
[size=3]Q. My game keeps crashing when I start it! What do I do?
A. Have you downloaded and installed both files (RE and RE_Core)? Are both files active?
[/size]If you installed the mod using NMM, when asked to upgrade, select "No".

Q. Is this compatible with mods that change perks, such as [i][color=orange]SkyRE[/color][/i], [i][color=orange]ACE[/color][/i], etc.?
A. Yes, most mods just edit vanilla perks, so there won't be any problem. If, instead, a mod removes these perks, you can simply turn off the perk requirements from the MCM.

Q. When I interact with property signs there's no options for buying. What do I do?
A. You need to progress in the tutorial (the quest "Becoming a Landlord").

[/size][size=3]Q. I can't complete the quest called "Becoming a Landlord". Is it a bug?
A. No, the quest is not meant to be completed (i.e. removed from the Active Quests) because that would break the mod (specifically the ledger would stop working). The last stage you can reach is when you are told to "create your own real estate", you can think of that as the end of the quest[/size].
author: M3t4lxxx

files.name: RE_v1.1
files.changelogHtml:
Purchasing a property allows to take low value items without it counting as stealing
Partial fix for the [...] bug: now it happens only on the owners of [u]some[/u] houses.
Better prices in a shop or inn you own - Requires [i]Trade&Barter[/i].

files.name: RE_v1.2
files.changelogHtml:
Buying a property requires now perks: Haggling (the first level) for Houses, Merchant for Shops, Investor for Inns and Master Trader for Specials.
Re-written MCM Script - Now it uses states instead of OIDs.
Property Ledgers tell in how many days you'll receive income.

files.name: RE_v1.2.1
files.changelogHtml: Added a MCM option for mods that change Speech Perks.

files.name: RE_v1.3
files.changelogHtml:
Replaced Master Ledgers with portable ones.
Activating the new MLs gives automatically income (temporary).

files.name: RE_v2.0
files.changelogHtml:
Replaced Property Ledgers with Property Signs, which are now outside the building.
Added Safes, from whom you can now collect income.
Slightly improved Master Ledger.
Added a list of properties in-game.
Added the option to choose how much tenants will have to pay.
Added more special properties.
Added a book which introduces the player to creating a Real Estate.
Added a key to the Safes on a table in the lower floor of The Winking Skeever (Solitude).

files.name: RE_v2.0.1
files.changelogHtml:
Bug fixed - Removed "Respawns" flag from Property Signs
Bug fixed - Removed old unused scripts which caused Papyrus errors.

files.name: RE_v2.1
files.changelogHtml:
Mines are now supported!
Added properties in Riverwood.
Added safes to minor holds.
Improved MCM.
Added loadscreens.

files.name: RE_v2.1.1
files.changelogHtml:
Fixed bug which didn't allow to buy some mines.
Every Property Sign now has a unique REF ID.
Added an option for uninstalling the mod safely and quickly.
Minor edits to the book "How to become a Landlord".
Renamed a few items.
Now Candlehearth Hall displays its owners.
Improved MCM.

files.name: RE_OCS Patch
files.changelogHtml:
Fixed bug which didn't allow to buy some mines.
Every Property Sign now has a unique REF ID.
Added an option for uninstalling the mod safely and quickly.
Minor edits to the book "How to become a Landlord".
Renamed a few items.
Now Candlehearth Hall displays its owners.
Improved MCM.

files.name: RE_v3.0_Core
files.changelogHtml:
Added Farms.
Added a way to save data and allow clean saves (RE_Core).
Added a list of properties owned.
Added a tutorial quest.
Minor changes to "How to become a Landlord".
Minor changes to the MCM.
Minor changes to Safes.
Changed the key's location (now it's a lot easier to find).
Changed the way you receive income: more compatibility with other mods.
And more minor changes...

files.name: RE_v3.0
files.changelogHtml:
Added Farms.
Added a way to save data and allow clean saves (RE_Core).
Added a list of properties owned.
Added a tutorial quest.
Minor changes to "How to become a Landlord".
Minor changes to the MCM.
Minor changes to Safes.
Changed the key's location (now it's a lot easier to find).
Changed the way you receive income: more compatibility with other mods.
And more minor changes...

files.name: RE_Fix_3-0-1
files.changelogHtml:
Fixed bug showing income would be received in a negative amount of days.
All properties generate income on the same day. Fixed possible bug related to not receiving income at times.
Added message when players try to take the deeds out of the safe.
Fixed intro quest not updating after having collected income.
